meanings.definition: The position or status of being a saint.
meanings.sent1: Her saintship was recognized by the entire village.
meanings.sent2: The saintship of Mother Teresa inspired many to help the poor.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the character claimed saintship after helping a lost puppy.
meanings.sent4: His saintship in the community was akin to a guiding light.
meanings.sent5: The young girl's saintship shone through her kind actions.

meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics of a saint.
meanings.sent1: The saintship of forgiveness and compassion was evident in her actions.
meanings.sent2: His saintship was evident in the way he always helped others selflessly.
meanings.sent3: Even in the chaos, her saintship of patience never wavered.
meanings.sent4: The saintship of bravery and selflessness was honored by all.
meanings.sent5: The saintship of humility and kindness made him beloved by all.
